WRITING.TEXT: Same. Guess we were all less rare than we thought!
I set the (then) world record in an Angry Birds level when I was 14.

Well I totally read "moose suicide".
under my foot and I reread.

I still think so. I don't think it's offensive to disagree about something like that. Though in this exact instance, I would say "you really don't remind me too much of that character, you're so nice and he is such a jerk" or whatever.

TV shows. If you know someone watches the same show as you, it's a great subject. It's impersonal because you are talking about fictional characters or people you don't really know but there is still a lot to talk about. For example: "Did you see the bachelor this week? I can't believe what Olivia said to Amanda about being a 'teen mom'. Do you think Ben will send her home next week?"

"Are you ok?"
In the USA strangers only ask that if you're CLEARLY not ok (i.e. puffy red eyes from crying). When a passerby asked me that I was worried I looked sick or terribly sad. Later learned that is like "how are you?" to them. Weird.
